input_text:
Job Title: AWS Catalyst PDS, Industries & Partner Solutions

Location: Atlanta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Information Technology

Description:
Description

Can you see the big picture and the details at the same time? Do you love learning as you execute, and making sure that your insights create lasting impact that scales well beyond your day-to-day work?

The Catalyst Initiative utilizes time-bound sprints to drive evergreen insights via immediate results. We engage Partners as a part of Industry-aligned workstreams to help our Partners achieve results, and in the process, we uncover scalable insights and socialize those learnings to our internal stakeholders.

In this role, youâ€™ll operate within the Industry & Partner Solutions Center of Excellence, surrounded by world class builders focusing on Industries, Solutions, Products & Services, and Generative AI, helping to define AWS Partner strategy aligned to these pillars.

To accelerate value for our rapidly-growing partner community, we are looking for a motivated, technically savvy person to build upon our ecosystem of AWS partners that work with, or provide consulting services to clients requiring cloud-based solutions from AWS.

Role

In this role, you will work with Independent Software Vendors (ISVs) and Systems Integrators (SIs) to build build and test Go To Market strategies aligned to key initiatives. You will work closely with your industry aligned peers with our organization, AWS Service teams who develop our services, other AWS Business Development Managers, AWS sales, marketing, and the APN team. You will be expected to:

 Develop and drive strategy to utilize the Catalyst methodology to achieve results and drive insights aligned to business needs. Develop and drive business and technical enablement plans to partners to facilitate the implementation and operations of AWS services. Promote top partners to AWS customers and sellers globally Work with regional leads to identify and develop partners globally Develop and drive promotions, funding benefits, and incentives as appropriate Gather, organize, and report back partner feedback (both technical and business) to help improve the customer and partner experience Own communication strategy: Contribute updates to internal communication channels, and keep key stakeholders informed of changes, events, and opportunities.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Atlanta, GA, USA

Basic Qualifications

 5+ years of professional or military experience Bachelor's degree Experience developing strategies that influence leadership decisions at the organizational level Experience managing programs across cross functional teams, building processes and coordinating release schedules

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience interpreting data and making business recommendations

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.



Company - Amazon Web Services, Inc.

Job ID: A2605373

Experience Level (if available): None
